title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: tinyForestR set tools designed extract, manipulate analyse data relevant location Tiny Forests UK. Specifically extracts processes landcover biodiversity data range sources given area around Tiny Forest locations, provides set tools analysing citizen science data derived directly Tiny Forests.

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: package hosted Github work progress. can installed running devtools::install_github("julianflowers/tinyForestR"). package makes use number Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) require API keys need applied separately. outlined relevant sections vignette. also uses range Python packages access datasets (cases Python packages better developed R). reason first step run initialise_tf() intialise package. : Loads reticulate R uses talk Python Sets Python virtual environment (VE) called tinyforest, ensures R uses correct version Python specifying RETICULATE_PYTHON environment variable. may necessary restart R make sure R correctly uses . asked want remove tinyforest environment. Say “” unless previous installation trouble. create clean install VE. Installs number Python packages tinyforest environment. include earthengine-api enables access Google Earth Engine (GEE) geemap - set added value tools extract manipulate GEE data osdatahub - access Ordnance Survey National Geographic Database data. OSGridConverter - converts lat-longs UK Grid references Imports relevant modules use packages

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
code: if(!require("tinyForestR")) devtools::install_github("julianflowers/tinyForestR", force = TRUE) if(!require("pacman"))install.packages("pacman") library(tinyForestR)  p_load(leaflet.extras2, tidyverse, mapview, sf, ggmap, lubridate)  initialise_tf() #> Virtual environment 'tinyforest' removed. #> Using Python: /opt/homebrew/Cellar/python@3.11/3.11.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.11/bin/python3.11 #> Creating virtual environment 'tinyforest' ...  #> Done! #> Installing packages: 'pip', 'wheel', 'setuptools', 'numpy' #> Virtual environment 'tinyforest' successfully created. #> Using virtual environment 'tinyforest' ...

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: next step load Tiny Forest (TF) data. exists series web pages get_tf_data function identifies relevant pages iterates extract name, id, location, area, planters, types tree planted (list column), TFs planted time extraction. include TFs planted outside UK. function takes 30 seconds iterate relevant pages. data loaded can save csv file get high level information planting, timings, size . 2023-06-06 190 planted TFs.
code: tictoc::tic() tf_data <- get_tf_data() tictoc::toc() tf <- read_csv("../data/tf_data.csv")  tf_df <- tf |>   unnest("trees") |>   mutate(year = year(date),           month = month(date)) needs(patchwork)  ## annual planting  tf_year <- tf_df |>   select(-trees) |>   distinct() |>   count(year) |>   ggplot(aes(year, n)) +   geom_col() +   labs(title = "TFs planted per year")  ## area distribution  tf_area <- tf_df |>   select(-trees) |>   distinct() |>   ggplot(aes(factor(year), area)) +   geom_boxplot() +   labs(title = "TF area year")  tf_trees <- tf_df |>   group_by(tf_id) |>   summarise(n_trees = n()) |>   ggplot() +   geom_histogram(aes(n_trees)) +   labs(title = "Distribution of tree species",         x = "Number of tree species")  tf_year + tf_area + tf_trees

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: now straightforward map locations TFs using sf mapview.
code: library(mapview)  tf_df |>   select(-trees) |>   distinct() |>   mutate(year = factor(year)) |>   sf::st_as_sf(coords = c("lon", "lat"), crs = 4326) |>   mapview(zcol = "year")

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: can also look planting frequency different tree species.
code: tf_df |>   ungroup() |>   unnest("trees") |>   count(trees, sort = TRUE) |>   top_n(25) |>   ggplot() +   geom_col(aes(n, reorder(trees, n))) +   labs(y = "",         title = "25 most commonly planted tree species") +   ggthemes::theme_base() +   theme(plot.title.position = "plot")

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: get_nbn_buffer downloads occurrence data NBN Atlas set buffer around given longitude latitude. example can download 10000 records around lat=51.777889, lon=-1.469139 (Witney TF).1
code: tf1 <- tf_df |>  select(lat, lon, tf_id) |>   distinct()  i <- 1  lat <- tf1$lat[i] lon <- tf1$lon[i] safe_buff <- safely(tinyForestR::get_nbn_buffer)  nbn_data <- safe_buff(lon, lat, n = 10000) #> 4.351 sec elapsed  nbn_data$result |>   head() #>    kingdom       phylum        classs         order    family     genus #> 1  Plantae Tracheophyta Magnoliopsida       Rosales  Rosaceae Crataegus #> 2 Animalia     Chordata          Aves Passeriformes   Paridae     Parus #> 3  Plantae Tracheophyta Magnoliopsida   Gentianales Rubiaceae    Galium #> 4  Plantae Tracheophyta Magnoliopsida       Fabales  Fabaceae      <NA> #> 5 Animalia     Chordata          Aves Passeriformes  Turdidae    Turdus #> 6 Animalia     Chordata          Aves Passeriformes  Turdidae    Turdus #>   decimalLatitude decimalLongitude year month #> 1        51.78306        -1.474075 2017    04 #> 2        51.78298        -1.472293 2010    10 #> 3        51.78256        -1.476333 2017    04 #> 4        51.77845        -1.465098 1968  <NA> #> 5        51.78298        -1.472293 2010    12 #> 6        51.78298        -1.472293 2019    03 #>                         dataProviderName           speciesGroups #> 1 Botanical Society of Britain & Ireland Plants, FloweringPlants #> 2          British Trust for Ornithology          Animals, Birds #> 3 Botanical Society of Britain & Ireland Plants, FloweringPlants #> 4 Botanical Society of Britain & Ireland Plants, FloweringPlants #> 5          British Trust for Ornithology          Animals, Birds #> 6          British Trust for Ornithology          Animals, Birds #>     vernacularName             species #> 1 Midland Hawthorn Crataegus laevigata #> 2        Great Tit         Parus major #> 3         Cleavers      Galium aparine #> 4             Bean                <NA> #> 5        Blackbird       Turdus merula #> 6        Blackbird       Turdus merula

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: also included functions extract data 2020 Botanic Society Britain Ireland survey. publicly available UK National Grid 1k hectads. requires conversion lat-longs UK grids.
code: grid_ref <- tinyForestR::os_lat_lon_to_grid(lat = lat, lon = lon) #> Using virtual environment 'tinyforest' ...  grid_ref$grid #> [1] "SP3672" bsbi_data <- tinyForestR::get_bsbi_data(grid_ref = grid_ref$grid)  bsbi_data |>   enframe() |>   unnest("value") |>   unnest("value") |>   # slice(-c(168:173)) |>   mutate(year = str_extract(value, "20\\d{2}"),          value = str_remove(value, year),          count = parse_number(value),          value = str_remove(value, as.character(count)),           value = str_remove(value, "\\d{1,}"),           grid = grid_ref$grid,           tf_id = tf_df$tf_id[i]) |>   arrange(value)  |>   drop_na() #> # A tibble: 7 × 6 #>   name    value                       year  count grid   tf_id #>   <chr>   <chr>                       <chr> <dbl> <chr>  <dbl> #> 1 records "Clinopodium ascendens()  " 2018      1 SP3672    85 #> 2 records "Cochlearia danica()  "     2016      1 SP3672    85 #> 3 records "Crataegus monogyna()  "    2015      1 SP3672    85 #> 4 records "Cupressus × leylandii()  " 2016      1 SP3672    85 #> 5 records "Galeopsis bifida()  "      2015      1 SP3672    85 #> 6 records "Hesperis matronalis()  "   2017      1 SP3672    85 #> 7 records "Oenothera stricta()  "     2017      1 SP3672    85

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: calc_bd_metrics function takes output get_nbn_buffer get_bsbi_data, converts data long wide format, creates species matrix specified class (get_nbn_buffer data), outputs list containing: diversity metrics (Simpson) species richness month (plotted) Bray-Curtis matrix Raup matrix

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: package includes calc_ndvi_buff function enable calculation normalized vegetation index (NDVI) buffer area around given point. uses Sentinel2 surface reflectance satellite images available 10m resolution regularly updated. function extracts images via Google Earth Engine API requires registration authentication prior use (see…). function returns list including, image dates, NDVI statistics image, interactive map raster. Note may take minutes run. code chunk calculates NDVI image containing buffer around Witney TF 2019 2022 maps side--side. (Note, function selects S2 images cloud cover < 10%). 25 images 2019 median NDVI 0.62, 23 2022 median NDVI 0.64.
code: ndvi_2019 <- calc_ndvi_buff(lat = lat, lon = lon, dist = 1000, start_date = "2019-01-01", end_date = "2019-12-31")  ndvi_2022 <- calc_ndvi_buff(lat = lat, lon = lon, dist = 1000, start_date = "2022-01-01", end_date = "2022-12-31")  bind_rows(ndvi_2019$ndvi_stats, ndvi_2022$ndvi_stats)  ndvi_2019$map | ndvi_2022$map

title: How to use the `tinyForestR` package
text: included snapshot environmental variables TF dataset. includes age TF, rural-urban classification lower super output area containing TF centroid, area (m2) public parks allotments buffer taken OS Open Greenspace data, area (m2) deciduous woodland, taken Priority Habitat Inventory data.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Julian Flowers. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Flowers J (2023). tinyForestR: Extract, manipulate analyse data Tiny Forests UK. https://github.com/julianflowers/tinyForestR, https://julianflowers.github.io/tinyForestR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tinyForestR: Extract, manipulate and analyse data for Tiny Forests in the UK},   author = {Julian Flowers},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/julianflowers/tinyForestR, https://julianflowers.github.io/tinyForestR/}, }

title: calculate seasonal bd metrics — calc_bd_metrics
text: function calculates various biodiversity metrics (richness diversity) given tiny forest class

title: calculate seasonal bd metrics — calc_bd_metrics
code: calc_bd_metrics(df, class)

title: calculate seasonal bd metrics — calc_bd_metrics
text: class class metrics need calculated tfid tiny forest id metrics need calculated

title: calculate seasonal bd metrics — calc_bd_metrics
text: list containing following: metrics  : data.frame containing monthly values metrics matrix   : data.frame containing monthly count species site, wide format plot     : ggplot object showing monthly variation richness

title: calculate seasonal bd metrics — calc_bd_metrics
code: calc_bd_metrics(85, 'Aves') #> data.table 1.14.8 using 1 threads (see ?getDTthreads). what: Calculate normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) within a buffer around a point location — calc_ndvi_buff
title: Calculate normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) within a buffer around a point location — calc_ndvi_buff
text: function takes latitude, longitude, buffer distance, start end time period, cloud cover percentage, returns map NDVI within buffer region, along statistics NDVI values within buffer.

title: Calculate normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) within a buffer around a point location — calc_ndvi_buff
code: calc_ndvi_buff(   lat = 25.1972,   lon = 55.2744,   dist = 500,   start_date = "2021-01-01",   end_date = "2021-12-31",   cloud_cover = 10 )

title: Calculate normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) within a buffer around a point location — calc_ndvi_buff
text: lat Numeric. latitude point location interest. lon Numeric. longitude point location interest. dist Numeric. distance meters draw buffer around point location. start_date Character. start date format 'YYYY-MM-DD' time period interest. end_date Character. end date format 'YYYY-MM-DD' time period interest. cloud_cover Numeric. maximum allowable percentage cloud cover satellite imagery used calculate NDVI. Default 10.

title: Calculate normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) within a buffer around a point location — calc_ndvi_buff
text: list object containing following components: map: map two layers displaying NDVI input point location. tidy_dates: tidied version image collection start end dates associated image collection#' image_ids: vector image IDs corresponding images used calculation. raster: raster layer object NDVI values within buffer region. ndvi_stats: Summary statistics NDVI values within buffer region, including median, minimum, maximum, mean standard deviation.

title: Calculate normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) within a buffer around a point location — calc_ndvi_buff
text: COPERNICUS/S2_SR_HARMONIZED image collection. rgee package documentation: https://csaybar.github.io/rgee/index.html tidyrgee package documentation: https://csaybar.github.io/tidyrgee/index.html zoo package documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/zoo/index.html terra package documentation: https://rspatial.org/terr'

title: Calculate normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) within a buffer around a point location — calc_ndvi_buff
code: calc_ndvi_buff(lat = 25.1972, lon = 55.2744, dist = 500, start_date = '2021-01-01', end_date = '2021-12-31',cloud_cover = 10) #> Loading required package: reticulate #> Loading required package: rgee #> Loading required package: tidyrgee #>  #> Attaching package: ‘tidyrgee’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter #> The following object is masked from ‘package:graphics’: #>  #>     clip #> Loading required package: zoo #>  #> Attaching package: ‘zoo’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     as.Date, as.Date.numeric #> Loading required package: terra #> terra 1.7.29 #>  #> Attaching package: ‘terra’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:zoo’: #>  #>     time<- #> The following object is masked from ‘package:tidyr’: #>  #>     extract #> The following object is masked from ‘package:data.table’: #>  #>     shift #> Error in py_discover_config(required_module, use_environment): Python specified in RETICULATE_PYTHON (Users/julianflowers/.virtualenvs/geemap/bin/python) does not exist

what: Create a species matrix from a dataframe — create_species_matrix
title: Create a species matrix from a dataframe — create_species_matrix
text: function takes input dataframe, species tf_id columns, creates matrix species rows tf_id columns. Entries matrix counts number times species occurs site (represented tf_id).

title: Create a species matrix from a dataframe — create_species_matrix
code: create_species_matrix(df, class)

title: Create a species matrix from a dataframe — create_species_matrix
text: df dataframe columns 'tf_id', 'species', 'classs' class string indicating ecological class interest

title: Create a species matrix from a dataframe — create_species_matrix
text: list two elements: sp, species--tf_id matrix species counts; sites, vector unique tf_id values indicating sites represented matrix.

title: Create a species matrix from a dataframe — create_species_matrix
code: data(iris) iris_species <- iris %>% select(Species) %>% mutate(classs = 'example') %>% rename(species = Species, tf_id = classs) create_species_matrix(iris_species, 'example') #> Error in create_species_matrix(iris_species, "example"): could not find function "create_species_matrix"

what: Retrieves BSBI( Botanical Society of Britain and Ireland) data for a given grid reference — get_bsbi_data
title: Retrieves BSBI( Botanical Society of Britain and Ireland) data for a given grid reference — get_bsbi_data
text: Retrieves BSBI( Botanical Society Britain Ireland) data given grid reference

title: Retrieves BSBI( Botanical Society of Britain and Ireland) data for a given grid reference — get_bsbi_data
code: get_bsbi_data(grid_ref)

title: Retrieves BSBI( Botanical Society of Britain and Ireland) data for a given grid reference — get_bsbi_data
text: grid_ref valid UK Ordnance Survey grid reference

title: Retrieves BSBI( Botanical Society of Britain and Ireland) data for a given grid reference — get_bsbi_data
text: list containing records BSBI database given grid reference

title: Retrieves BSBI( Botanical Society of Britain and Ireland) data for a given grid reference — get_bsbi_data
code: get_bsbi_data("NY7250") get_bsbi_data("TQ3080")

what: Retrieves occurrence data from NBN Atlas within a specified buffer around given longitude and latitude — get_nbn_buffer
title: Retrieves occurrence data from NBN Atlas within a specified buffer around given longitude and latitude — get_nbn_buffer
text: Retrieves occurrence data NBN Atlas within specified buffer around given longitude latitude

title: Retrieves occurrence data from NBN Atlas within a specified buffer around given longitude and latitude — get_nbn_buffer
code: get_nbn_buffer(lon, lat, radius = 1, n = 10000)

title: Retrieves occurrence data from NBN Atlas within a specified buffer around given longitude and latitude — get_nbn_buffer
text: lon numeric Longitude decimal degrees lat numeric Latitude decimal degrees radius numeric Buffer radius kilometers, default 1 km n numeric Maximum number occurrences retrieve, default 10,000

title: Retrieves occurrence data from NBN Atlas within a specified buffer around given longitude and latitude — get_nbn_buffer
text: data frame containing occurrence information within buffer

title: Get NDVI time series — get_ndvi_time_series
code: get_ndvi_time_series(   lon,   lat,   start = "2019-01-01",   end = "2023-01-01",   ic = "COPERNICUS/S2_SR",   buffer1 = 50,   buffer2 = 1000 )

title: Get NDVI time series — get_ndvi_time_series
text: lon numeric: Longitude location interest. lat numeric: Latitude location interest. start character: Start date time frame, YYYY-MM-DD format (default '2019-01-01'). end character: End date time frame, YYYY-MM-DD format (default '2023-01-01'). ic character: Google Earth Engine ImageCollection name (default "COPERNICUS/S2_SR"). buffer1 numeric: Buffer around point interest, meters (default 100). buffer2 numeric: Buffer around point interest retrieve summary statistics, meters (default 1000).

title: Get NDVI time series — get_ndvi_time_series
text: list containing: summary_point Summary statistics NDVI values specified point#'  sdStandard deviation NDVI values specified point summary_buffSummary statistics NDVI values within buffer2 around specified point sd_buffStandard deviation NDVI values within buffer2 around specified point plotVisualization time series NDVI values specified point function retrieves time series Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) values specified location within given time frame. function returns list containing summary statistics NDVI values specified point visualization time series. get_ndvi_time_series(-121.7, 36.9)

title: Get PhyloPic Image — get_phylopic_image
text: function retrieves image PhyloPic API saves specified directory.

title: Get PhyloPic Image — get_phylopic_image
code: get_phylopic_image(search, path)

title: Get PhyloPic Image — get_phylopic_image
text: search character string containing name organism scientific name taxon. path character string specifying directory save image file.

title: Get PhyloPic Image — get_phylopic_image
text: image saved directory specified path parameter.

title: Get PhyloPic Image — get_phylopic_image
code: get_phylopic_image("Homo sapiens", "C:/images/") #> Error in get_phylopic_image("Homo sapiens", "C:/images/"): could not find function "get_phylopic_image" get_phylopic_image("Gorilla gorilla", "D:/pictures/") #> Error in get_phylopic_image("Gorilla gorilla", "D:/pictures/"): could not find function "get_phylopic_image"

what: Retrieves and formats data from the Tiny Forest Earthwatch website — get_tf_data
title: Retrieves and formats data from the Tiny Forest Earthwatch website — get_tf_data
text: function scrapes Tiny Forest Earthwatch website obtain data Tiny Forest site including GPS coordinates, planted date, area, planted species.

title: Retrieves and formats data from the Tiny Forest Earthwatch website — get_tf_data
code: get_tf_data()

title: Retrieves and formats data from the Tiny Forest Earthwatch website — get_tf_data
text: tidy data frame Tiny Forest site information including GPS coordinates, planted date, area, planted species site

title: Retrieves and formats data from the Tiny Forest Earthwatch website — get_tf_data
code: get_tf_data() #> Skipping install of 'myScrapers' from a github remote, the SHA1 (27d682b5) has not changed since last install. #>   Use `force = TRUE` to force installation #> Loading required package: httr #> Warning: There was 1 warning in `mutate()`. #> ℹ In argument: `date = dmy(plant_date)`. #> ℹ In group 131: `tf_id = 276`. #> Caused by warning: #> ! All formats failed to parse. No formats found.

title: Get Natural Water Features — get_water_features
text: function extracts natural water features within given buffer around specified tf_id location.

title: Get Natural Water Features — get_water_features
code: get_water_features(df, tf_id = 85, buffer = 1000)

title: Get Natural Water Features — get_water_features
text: df data.frame containing location data. tf_id integer specifying focal point analysis. buffer numeric value specifying desired buffer size meters.

title: Get Natural Water Features — get_water_features
text: list two items: d spatial objects data.frame (sf) containing natural water features within buffer. b spatial objects data.frame (sf) containing buffer area around focal point.

title: Get Natural Water Features — get_water_features
code: if (FALSE) { get_water_features(df, tf_id = 25, buffer = 500) }

what: Initialize TinyForest package virtual environment — initialise_tf
title: Initialize TinyForest package virtual environment — initialise_tf
text: function initializes TinyForest environment required dependencies libraries.

title: Initialize TinyForest package virtual environment — initialise_tf
code: initialise_tf()

title: Initialize TinyForest package virtual environment — initialise_tf
text: explicit output, function creates configures required environment TinyForest

title: Initialize TinyForest package virtual environment — initialise_tf
code: initialize_tf() #> Error in initialize_tf(): could not find function "initialize_tf"

what: Convert Latitude and Longitude to Ordnance Survey Grid Reference — os_lat_lon_to_grid
title: Convert Latitude and Longitude to Ordnance Survey Grid Reference — os_lat_lon_to_grid
text: function uses 'OSGridConverter' Python package convert latitude longitude coordinates Ordnance Survey grid references.

title: Convert Latitude and Longitude to Ordnance Survey Grid Reference — os_lat_lon_to_grid
code: os_lat_lon_to_grid(lat, lon)

title: Convert Latitude and Longitude to Ordnance Survey Grid Reference — os_lat_lon_to_grid
text: lat numeric vector latitude coordinates lon numeric vector longitude coordinates

title: Convert Latitude and Longitude to Ordnance Survey Grid Reference — os_lat_lon_to_grid
text: list string containing Ordnance Survey grid reference lat-lon coordinate pair.

title: Convert Latitude and Longitude to Ordnance Survey Grid Reference — os_lat_lon_to_grid
code: os_lat_lon_to_grid(-2.353, 51.509) #> Warning: Previous request to `use_python("/usr/local/bin/python3", required = TRUE)` will be ignored. It is superseded by request to `use_python("/Users/julianflowers/.virtualenvs/tinyforest/bin/python") #> Using virtual environment 'tinyforest' ... #> + '/Users/julianflowers/.virtualenvs/tinyforest/bin/python' -m pip install --upgrade --no-user 'OSGridConverter'

title: Plot OS Land Cover — plot_os_land_cover
text: Generate interactive map Ordnance Survey (OS) Land Cover data around specified coordinate using OS Data Hub API.

title: Plot OS Land Cover — plot_os_land_cover
code: plot_os_land_cover(lon, lat, key, buff = 1000, n = 5000L)

title: Plot OS Land Cover — plot_os_land_cover
text: lon numeric value indicating longitude required point (e.g. -0.1426) lat numeric value indicating latitude required point (e.g. 51.5244) key character value OS Data Hub API key use buff numeric value indicating buffer around specified point metres (default = 1000) n integer value indicating maximum number results return (default = 10000)

title: Plot OS Land Cover — plot_os_land_cover
text: returns list including following objects: sf: sf object containing queried data, map: interactive map generated using queried data, tiers: sf object containing tier B land cover information.

title: Plot OS Land Cover — plot_os_land_cover
text: Requires OS Data Hub API key needed packages run (tidyverse, reticulate, mapview, sf, tictoc, colourspace, leaflet).

title: Plot OS Land Cover — plot_os_land_cover
code: # Generate a plot of land cover around the London Eye key <- "insert OS Data Hub API key" plot_os_land_cover(lon = -0.1194, lat = 51.5033, key = key) #> Error: requests.exceptions.HTTPError: 400 Client Error: Bad Request for url: https://api.os.uk/features/ngd/ofa/v1/collections/lnd-fts-land-1/items/?filter=INTERSECTS%28geometry%2C+POLYGON+%28%28999.8806+-948.4967%2C+999.8806+1051.5033%2C+-1000.1194+1051.5033%2C+-1000.1194+-948.4967%2C+999.8806+-948.4967%29%29%29&filter-crs=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.opengis.net%2Fdef%2Fcrs%2FEPSG%2F0%2F27700&limit=100&offset=0

title: Save ggmap Images — save_ggmap_images
text: function saves ggmap satellite image given longitude latitude.

title: Save ggmap Images — save_ggmap_images
code: save_ggmap_images(lon, lat, key)

title: Save ggmap Images — save_ggmap_images
text: lon longitude center image lat latitude center image key Google API key ggmap imagery

title: Save ggmap Images — save_ggmap_images
code: save_ggmap_images(-71.0636, 42.3581, "API_key") #> Error in save_ggmap_images(-71.0636, 42.3581, "API_key"): could not find function "save_ggmap_images"

title: Tiny Forest (TF) data — tf_data

code: tf_data  tf_data

title: Tiny Forest (TF) data — tf_data
text: data frame 190 rows 7 variables: tf_id double Tiny Forest ID plant_date character Date planted area double Area m2 trees list Tree species planted lat double Decimal latitude lon double Decimal longitude date double Date planted data frame 190 rows 7 variables: tf_id double COLUMN_DESCRIPTION plant_date character COLUMN_DESCRIPTION area double COLUMN_DESCRIPTION trees list COLUMN_DESCRIPTION lat double COLUMN_DESCRIPTION lon double COLUMN_DESCRIPTION date double COLUMN_DESCRIPTION

what: tinyForestR: Extract, manipulate and analyse data for Tiny Forests in the UK — tinyForestR-package

text: Maintainer: Julian Flowers jrf128@student.aru.ac.uk (ORCID)
